txt.en: Complete Instance: The Fading of the Forests
You escorted Agalûnu to meet with Shanthar. He explained why she should not clear-cut trees, especially in Ambarûl. You should talk to Agalûnu and find out what she is thinking.
Agalûnu has asked you to take her to meet the warden of Arwáth. You should tell her when you are ready to go.

'I am a fool [placeholder]. I had no idea the whole of Ambarûl was once covered in a lush forest of such extraordinary trees. Worse yet, I am no better than my forebears who destroyed them. Like I did, they doubtless took for granted that it would always be there, no matter what.'

Agalûnu sits in silent thought for several moments before she winces.

'I spoke the truth when I told the Kinta I wanted to help, but I confess that perhaps my wound is not as healed as I thought. I do not think I will be capable of helping him anytime soon.'
TBD Let's talk back at my camp
'Are you ready to go? I will talk to this ignorant Kinta and make him see reason.'
Upset that she has been asked to leave Arwáth, Agalûnu wishes to speak to Shanathar directly.

'This is madness, [placeholder]. I am well enough for a little travel. I would like you to take me to this supposed Kinta Elf. I will talk to him and see what, exactly, is so important that he would shoot someone but not speak with them. Tell me when you are ready to leave.'
